Class Buffer<T>

java.lang.Object
Buffer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of the buffer
public class Buffer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
An ArrayBlockingQueue buffer that links two nodes together. An element is put or taken from the queue by accessing the putBlocking(Order) and getBlocking() methods respectively. If there are any issues getting or setting items in the buffer the thread will wait until notified.
Author:
Wil Simpson

  • Constructor Details

    • Buffer

      public Buffer()
      Creates a new queue with a size of 1

    • Buffer

      public Buffer​(int queueSize)
      Creates a new buffer with the given size and sets the id
      Parameters:
      queueSize - size of the buffer

  • Method Details

    • putBlocking

      public void putBlocking​(T t)
      Attempts to put the given item in the queue. The thread will wait until the queue has room and the item can be put into the queue
      Parameters:
      t - Object to put in the queue

    • getBlocking

      public T getBlocking()
      Gets the next item in the queue. If the queue is empty the thread will wait until it can get an item
      Returns:
      item retrieved from queue

    • setUpstreamFinished

      public void setUpstreamFinished()
      Marks the buffer that the upstream buffer is finished processing

    • isUpstreamFinished

      public boolean isUpstreamFinished()
      Checks if the upstream is finished processing
      Returns:
      true if the upstream is finished processing

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the queue is empty
      Returns:
      true if queue is empty

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the queue is full
      Returns:
      true if the queue is full

    • shouldContinueAcceptingInput

      public boolean shouldContinueAcceptingInput()
      Checks if the downstream buffer should keep processing. A downstream queue should only stop processing if the upstream node is finished and teh queue size is 0.
      Returns:
      true if the downstream node should keep getting input

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      String readable representation of a buffer containing its id id and size
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation
